Package my.Checkers.core

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
my.Checkers.core.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Object
This class is responsible for the methods connected with the pieces of the board

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Pawn()
    This is a non-arg constructor of Pawn that creates an white pawn
    Pawn(char pawn)
    This is a parameterized constructor that creates according to his char representation
    Pawn(Checkers.PieceColor color)
    This is a parameterized constructor that creates an pawn of the wanted color

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn()

      This is a non-arg constructor of Pawn that creates an white pawn

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(Checkers.PieceColor color)

      This is a parameterized constructor that creates an pawn of the wanted color

      Parameters:
      color - it is a PieceColor type parameter that indicates the color of the pawn that we want to create

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(char pawn)

      This is a parameterized constructor that creates according to his char representation

      Parameters:
      pawn - it is a char representation of the piece

  • Method Details

    • setKing

      public void setKing(boolean king)
      This method determines whether a piece is king or not
      Parameters:
      king - is boolean, if it is true then the pawn is king

    • getPieceColor

      public Checkers.PieceColor getPieceColor()
      This method returns the color of pawn
      Returns:
      PieceColor enum type.

    • isKing

      public boolean isKing()
      This method return whether this pawn is king or not
      Returns:
      true if king, else false

    • allDestinations

      public Position[] allDestinations(Checkers checkers, Position p)
      This method returns all possible steps of the piece
      Parameters:
      checkers - Checkers type variable of our board
      p - is Position type variable of the piece that we want to know destinations
      Returns:
      Position array of all step destinations

    • eatPositions

      public Position[] eatPositions(Checkers checkers, Position p)
      This method returns all possible positions to eat of the piece
      Parameters:
      checkers - Checkers type variable of our board
      p - is Position type variable of the piece that we want to know positions
      Returns:
      Position array of all eating positions
